Subjects: prologues; Lord’s Prayer; prayers, bidding; Ave Marie
_description: Prologue to Pater noster, Ave Maria, etc. — twelve lines

BLCottCleoBVI.First Lines:
Bidde huue with milde steuenetil vre fader þe king of
                    heuene…
BLCottCleoBVI.Last Lines:
…and for all þat on herþe vs fedin and fostresaie we
                    nu alle þe hali pater noster
BLCottCleoBVI.Note:
Wright  and  Halliwell-Phillipps (1845)
XThomas Wright,   and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845, 1.22, lists as folio 201v. The MS
                    has been refoliated several times. The folio number here refers to the most
                    recent, written in the bottom right corner of each recto folio. Written as
                    prose.
BLCottCleoBVI.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.22.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932: 126-7.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 16.
